title: Tyre Pressure Sensor - Installation - (if fitted)

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
When the tyre valve is removed, the seal on the tyre valve must be replaced. Failure to change the seal may result in tyre pressure loss leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If fitting the original tyre pressure sensors, make sure they are fitted to the correct wheel using the serial number on the sensor as noted for removal.
If fitting new tyre pressure sensors, record the serial numbers of the front and rear tyre pressure sensors in the spaces provided on the relevant page of the Owner’s Handbook.
The method for the installation of the tyre pressure sensor is the same for the front and rear wheels.
Make sure that the mounting hole on the wheel rim and the area around it is free from any dirt or grease.
Examine the seal on the tyre valve. If the seal is damaged, you must replace the valve assembly.
Align the tyre valve to its mounting hole in the wheel rim. Make sure the tyre valve orientation is the same as noted for removal.
The edges of the tyre pressure sensor must be parallel to the walls of the wheel well. Damage to the sensor may result if the sensor is not correctly installed.
Fit the sensor to the tyre valve and install a new fixing. Tighten the fixing of the sensor to
. Make sure that the sensor is not forced against the walls of the wheel well while tightening.
Make sure that the position of the sensor is parallel to the walls of the wheel rim, as shown in the illustration below.
Refit the tyre noting the following:
The tyre lever/installation tool must start 30° away from the tyre valve and move away from the tyre valve.
Check and, if necessary, adjust the balance of the wheel.
